meanings.definition: Having the carpels of a flower united to form a single compound ovary.
meanings.sent1: The syncarpous flower had a unique ovary structure.
meanings.sent2: The syncarpous plants in the garden had fused ovaries.
meanings.sent3: The syncarpous flower seemed like a puzzle to the botanist.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were syncarpous, merging into a single complex idea.
meanings.sent5: The syncarpous feature of the flower made it stand out among the rest.
